episodes.title: Behind The Stargate - Secrets Revealed

episodes.plot: Amanda Tapping takes us on a fascinating look at how many aspects surrounding SG-1 have a basis in real science.
episodes.title: Stargate SG-1- True Science

episodes.plot: The 200th episode of the venerated sci-fi series is discussed during this special.
episodes.title: Sci Fi Inside- Stargate SG-1 200

episodes.plot: As SG-1 searches for an Ancient artifact which they hope can defeat the armies of the Ori, they learn more Ori ships are about to be sent through the Supergate to launch a final assault on Earth. Daniel discovers that the artifact, the Ark of Truth, may be in the Ori home galaxy, and SG-1 embarks aboard the Odyssey to find it, and pre-empt the attack. The IOA has a plan of their own and SG-1 ends up in a distant galaxy fighting two powerful enemies.
episodes.title: The Ark of Truth

episodes.plot: While SG-1 attends the execution of Ba'al, the last of the Goa'uld System Lords, Teal'c and Vala inexplicably disappear into thin air. Carter, Daniel and Mitchell race back to a world where history has been changed: the Stargate program has been erased from the timeline. As they try to convince the authorities what's happened, a fleet of Goa'uld motherships arrives in orbit, led by Ba'al, his queen, Qetesh (Vala), and his first prime, Teal'c. SG-1 must find the Stargate and set things right before the world is enslaved by the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Continuum

episodes.plot: This special deals with how the SG-1 series intertwined many of Earth's mythologies into its plots and story lines, and about the many alien character connections with Earth’s great mythological figures.
episodes.title: Behind The Mythology of Stargate SG-1

episodes.plot:
Taking after the author's vision of the pilot, visual effects have been enhanced, the soundtrack has been updated to include an entirely original score, and the new final cut features a more self-contained storyline. 

Picking up the story nearly a year after the original 1994 Stargate film, Jack O'Neill and Sam Carter join a formidable Stargate team on a mission to Abydos to defeat fierce warriors led by the vicious Ra. With the threat of the brutal Gou'ald hanging over the galaxy, the team must succeed - or General Hammond will unleash an apocalyptic solution!
episodes.title: Children of the Gods - Final Cut

episodes.plot: When powerful aliens come through Earth's Stargate, Colonel Jack O'Neill returns to Abydos to retrieve Daniel Jackson, who has discovered that the alien transit system includes much more than the two planets.
episodes.title: Children of the Gods (1)

episodes.plot: Colonel O'Neill, leading the new SG-1, track Apophis back to the planet Chulak to rescue Sha're and Skaara, and befriend one of Apophis' Jaffa guards.
episodes.title: Children of the Gods (2)

episodes.plot: Major Kawalsky is possessed by a Goa'uld, and the SGC must find a way to remove it without killing him.
episodes.title: The Enemy Within

episodes.plot: An alien civilization is forced to reconsider their views on women when Carter rebels against their social customs.
episodes.title: Emancipation

episodes.plot: Members of SG-1 become infected with an alien virus that turns them into primitive beings. Dr. Fraiser must find a cure to save the team and the alien population from whom it was contracted.
episodes.title: The Broca Divide

episodes.plot: SG-1 must stop a renegade Stargate commander, who has gone mad and set himself up as a god on an alien planet.
episodes.title: The First Commandment

episodes.plot: During an off-world assignment, Jack is struck down by energy from a blue crystal... which creates a duplicate of him that returns to Earth in Jack's place.
episodes.title: Cold Lazarus

episodes.plot: Pressed by the government to acquire new technologies, SG-1 is led to a world inhabited by a seemingly primative race. When Apophis arrives, SG-1 ambush him with disasterous consequences.
episodes.title: The Nox

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers a race of attractive people who age extremely rapidly. The situation becomes personal when O'Neill begins to suffer from the same accelerated aging, and must live out the rest of his life on the planet.
episodes.title: Brief Candle

episodes.plot: Teal'c and O'Neill are transported to an underground cage designed by the Asgard to protect an alien world from the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Thor's Hammer

episodes.plot: SG-1 tracks down Catherine Langford's fiancee, who took the first Stargate trip in 1945, and discovers an ancient meeting hall that may hold the secrets of the universe itself.
episodes.title: The Torment of Tantalus

episodes.plot: Teal'c returns to Chulak to stop his people from implanting his son with a larval Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Bloodlines

episodes.plot: Daniel is taken captive by an alien with a hidden agenda, while SG-1 is made to believe he is dead.
episodes.title: Fire and Water

episodes.plot: The banished Goa'uld Hathor is found in an ancient sarcophagus Earth, and takes over the S.G.C. with hopes of raising a new army against the System Lords.
episodes.title: Hathor

episodes.plot: A mysterious affliction wipes out the entire population of a planet, plus an SG team -- except for one young girl. Carter befriends her, but learns that she is being used by the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Singularity

episodes.plot: Teal'c must stand trial for a crime committed while he served as first prime of Apophis when a villager on an alien world identifies him as the Jaffa who killed his father.
episodes.title: Cor-Ai

episodes.plot: The SG-1 team rescues a group of advanced humans from a planet near destruction, and must find a new home for the refugees before the Pentagon gets their hands on them.
episodes.title: Enigma

episodes.plot: Colonel O'Neill and Captain Carter are separated from Jackson and Teal'c during a Stargate journey, and are trapped on a desolate ice world with no way of escape.
episodes.title: Solitudes

episodes.plot: The members of SG-1 arrive on P3X-989 and are knocked unconscious. They wake up and return to Earth only to find that they are not quite themselves.
episodes.title: Tin Man

episodes.plot: An alien artifact transports Daniel to an alternate reality, where he is not a part of the Stargate program and the Goa'uld -- led by Teal'c -- are invading Earth.
episodes.title: There But For the Grace of God

episodes.plot: Senator Kinsey arrives at the SGC to investigate the program and determine whether the great drain on the U.S. budget is worthwhile, prompting the team to recall missions from the past year.
episodes.title: Politics

episodes.plot: SG-1 escapes through the Stargate before it is shut down, and learns that Daniel's alternate reality vision is true: Apophis is moving to attack Earth from above. The team must stop Apophis and his son, Klorel, who inhabits the body of their friend Skaara.
episodes.title: Within the Serpent's Grasp

episodes.plot: With SG-1 trapped on Klorel's ship, it seems that Earth is doomed as the Pyramid Ships prepare to destroy Earth.
episodes.title: The Serpent's Lair

episodes.plot: Carter is possessed by a Goa'uld who claims to be an enemy of the System Lords.
episodes.title: In the Line of Duty

episodes.plot: SG-1 is put on trial and exiled to a prison world, where a woman maintains a strange control over her fellow prisoners.
episodes.title: Prisoners

episodes.plot: SG-1 is imprisoned in a virtual reality realm and forced to relive the worst moments of their lives over and over.
episodes.title: The Gamekeeper

episodes.plot: Jackson becomes addicted to the effects of a Goa'uld sarcophagus, and falls for the planet's manipulative princess.
episodes.title: Need

episodes.plot: SG-1 returns to Cimmeria, and finds that without protection from the Asgard the planet has been invaded by the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Thor's Chariot

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers an ancient artifact that takes O'Neill and the S.G.C. hostage.
episodes.title: Message in a Bottle

episodes.plot: The SG-1 team attempt to rescue Teal'c's son, who has been kidnapped and brainwashed by Apophis. Teal'c learns disturbing news about his wife.
episodes.title: Family

episodes.plot: Jackson discovers that his wife has returned to Abydos, and is nine months pregnant with the son of Apophis. O'Neill must keep the secret of the Stargate program from being uncovered.
episodes.title: Secrets

episodes.plot: Teal'c is infected with deadly venom from a giant insect, and begins a terrible transformation. When he escapes the S.G.C., SG-1 must find him before Colonel Maybourne does.
episodes.title: Bane

episodes.plot: SG-1 locates the Tok'ra, a Goa'uld resistence movement who oppose the System Lords, and attempt to form an alliance. Jacob Carter's cancer brings him near death.
episodes.title: The Tok'ra (1)

episodes.plot: While SG-1 tries to form an alliance with the Tok'ra, a spy betrays the rebels to the Goa'uld. Jacob Carter finds that the Tok'ra may be his only hope of survival
episodes.title: The Tok'ra (2)

episodes.plot: SG-1 finds a planet inhabited by Native American Indians, protected by spirits who are actually advanced alien shapeshifters.
episodes.title: Spirits

episodes.plot: SG-1 is accused of stealing an important weather-controlling device, sending a primative planet into chaos. The team discovers that Earth's second Stargate is being misused.
episodes.title: Touchstone

episodes.plot: O'Neill becomes the unwilling receptacle for a library of alien knowledge.
episodes.title: The Fifth Race

episodes.plot: After gating to a world on the edge of a black hole, the S.G.C. cannot disengage the Stargate. All of Earth becomes endangered by the time-distorting gravity field.
episodes.title: A Matter of Time

episodes.plot: Apophis, SG-1's greatest enemy, seeks sanctuary from Sokar and ends up near death in the S.G.C. infirmiry.
episodes.title: Holiday

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers an elderly man known for developing technology to fight the Goa'uld. Daniel is tricked into switching bodies with the man, Ma'chello, who believes he is "owed" for all the good he has done.
episodes.title: Serpent's Song

episodes.plot: A group of primitive aliens begin to fall deathly ill after SG-1 arrives.
episodes.title: One False Step

episodes.plot: A young boy arrives through the Stargate, and warns of plot by invisible aliens to kill all of the human race in order to rob the Goa'uld of potential hosts.
episodes.title: Show and Tell

episodes.plot: A cosmic accident causes SG-1 to be sent back 30 years into Earth's past, where they must locate the Stargate and find a way home.
O'Neill, Carter and Jackson awaken from stasis in what appears to be the S.G.C. -- almost 80 years in the future.
episodes.title: Out of Mind (1)

episodes.plot: O'Neill, Carter and Jackson must escape Hathor's clutches, while Teal'c tries to raise a Jaffa army on Chulak. General Hammond must take desperate measures to rescue the team.
episodes.title: Into the Fire (2)

episodes.plot: SG-1 must find a renegade Goa'uld who has been hiding on Earth for thousands of years.
episodes.title: Seth

episodes.plot: The Asgard aid Earth in negotiating a nonagression treaty with the Goa'uld System Lords.
episodes.title: Fair Game

episodes.plot: When Daniel goes insane, SG-1 must deal with the legacy of Machello's anti-Goa'uld technology.
episodes.title: Legacy

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers a planet where children are used to acquire knowledge for the entire population, then discarded.
episodes.title: Learning Curve

episodes.plot: SG-1 must free an alternate reality Earth from a Goa'uld invasion after duplicates of Samantha Carter and Charles Kawalsky come through the quantum mirror.
episodes.title: Point of View

episodes.plot: SG-1 is taken captive by an alien bounty hunter with uncertain loyalties.
episodes.title: Deadman Switch

episodes.plot: SG-1 finds a medieval Christian society terrorized by Sokar and the Unas, and is accused of being possessed by demons.
episodes.title: Demons

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers a military camp where young men are trained to impersonate SGC personnel to infiltrate Earth.
episodes.title: Rules of Engagement

episodes.plot: Jackson deals with the apparent death of his wife, Sha're, at the hands of Teal'c.
episodes.title: Forever in a Day

episodes.plot: SG-1 encounters an entire planet suffering from amnesia.  The planet's leader returns to Earth with SG-1 to find a cure,  but SG-1 suspects she may not be who she appears to be.
episodes.title: Past and Present

episodes.plot: When Major Carter's father Jacob is kidnapped by Sokar, the SG-1 team must infiltrate a prison moon designed to look like hell to rescue him.
episodes.title: Jolinar's Memories (1)

episodes.plot: SG-1 must escape a hellish prison moon, and one of their worst enemies.
episodes.title: The Devil You Know (2)

episodes.plot: SG-1 returns from a mission and discovers that metamorphic aliens have taken over the complex.
episodes.title: Foothold

episodes.plot: The Tollan put Skaara and Klorel on trial to determine who will control the host body.
episodes.title: Pretense

episodes.plot: SG-1 receives alien brain implants that manifest themselves as a bizarre man, who tells them that they would not survive the procedure to remove him.
episodes.title: Urgo

episodes.plot: After a meteor strike buries the Stargate, O'Neill finds himself stranded on a planet with no hope of rescue.
episodes.title: A Hundred Days

episodes.plot: O'Neill steals technology from the Tollan, and is forced to leave the Stargate program. Maybourne offers an intriguing proposal.
episodes.title: Shades of Grey

episodes.plot: The members of SG-1 are imprisoned on a planet and become pawns in a war of ideology.
episodes.title: New Ground

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers the mystical planet Kheb, and must find the Harcesis child of Apophis and Sha're before Apophis's army does.
episodes.title: Maternal Instinct

episodes.plot: An alien artifact causes Daniel to disappear, and the team looks for help from his institutionalized grandfather.
episodes.title: Crystal Skull

episodes.plot: SG-1 faces creatures of mass destruction that even the Asgard can't control, and must destroy Thor's infested vessel before the Replicator bugs reach Earth.
episodes.title: Nemesis (1)

episodes.plot: O'Neill and Teal'c risk their lives to keep the Replicator bugs from gaining a foothold on Earth, while Carter helps the Asgard fend off a Replicator invasion.
episodes.title: Small Victories (2)

episodes.plot: A warring alien race offers to exchange their advanced technology for Earth's help in defeating their enemy.
episodes.title: The Other Side

episodes.plot: A Tok'ra archaeologist arrives at the SGC with newly discovered technology, giving the SG-1 team superhuman powers.
episodes.title: Upgrades

episodes.plot: Teal'c is reunited with his lost love -- a woman who claims to have found a way to communicate with her symbiote and defeat the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Crossroads

episodes.plot: When a member of the SGC tries to kill a Tok'ra, it is revealed that O'Neill and Carter may be victims of an untraceable form of Goa'uld mind control.
episodes.title: Divide and Conquer

episodes.plot: O'Neill and Teal'c are caught in a time loop in the SGC, and must relive the same 10 hours over and over again.
episodes.title: Window of Opportunity

episodes.plot: The Russians recover a Stargate from the bottom of the ocean, and turn to the SGC for help when their experiments go awry.
episodes.title: Watergate

episodes.plot: Dr. Jackson is taken captive by an Unas while on an archaeological dig. The SGC mounts a rescue operation, but discovers a danger of their own.
episodes.title: The First Ones

episodes.plot: SG-1 is caught in a conflict between two civilizations trying to colonize the same planet.
episodes.title: Scorched Earth

episodes.plot: The members of SG-1 are used as forced labor in an underground alien facility after their memories are erased by the ruling elite.
episodes.title: Beneath the Surface

episodes.plot: SG-1 investigates a conspiracy theorist who has detailed knowledge of the Stargate program.
episodes.title: Point of No Return

episodes.plot: A test gone wrong leaves Jack and Teal'c marooned in space aboard a damaged prototype attack ship
episodes.title: Tangent

episodes.plot: When his former mentor dies, Dr. Jackson returns to his roots -- and discovers an ancient Egyptian artifact containing a Goa'uld parasite.
episodes.title: The Curse

episodes.plot: SG-1 must stop Apophis and Heru-ur from forming an alliance of their powerful forces, while Teal'c is captured and tortured by the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: The Serpent's Venom

episodes.plot: SG-1 must adjust to a new commanding officer when General Hammond steps down -- but O'Neill discovers foul play behind the general's resignation.
episodes.title: Chain Reaction

episodes.plot: Ten years into the future, the former members of SG-1 must send a message into the past to prevent the extinction of the human race.
Jackson's teammates notice a disturbing change in him when he is reunited with the Harcesis child and given the Goa'uld genetic memory.
episodes.title: Absolute Power

episodes.plot: SG-1 finds a deserted Goa'uld palace, where a beautiful device causes suicidal tendencies.
episodes.title: The Light

episodes.plot: Carter must help keep a promising young cadet from throwing away a future at the SGC. O'Neill and Teal'c encounter a dangerous life form at an offworld research base.
episodes.title: Prodigy

episodes.plot: The SGC is invaded by an alien life force that takes up residence in the base computer system -- and in Major Carter.
episodes.title: Entity

episodes.plot: SG-1 must rescue an alien world from the Goa'uld -- with help from an unexpected source. Teal'c seeks revenge on the System Lord Cronus for the murder of his father.
episodes.title: Double Jeopardy

episodes.plot: SG-1 helps to evacuate the Tok'ra to a new base -- but matters are complicated when a spy reveals their location to Apophis. The team attempts a daring plan to take out the Goa'uld's powerful fleet.
episodes.title: Exodus (1)

episodes.plot: SG-1 finds themselves stranded in a crippled ship in a distant galaxy -- with Apophis threatening to destroy them. Teal'c is brainwashed and made loyal to Apophis once again.
episodes.title: Enemies (2)

episodes.plot: His mind altered by Apophis, Teal'c must undergo a ritual that takes him to the edge of death itself, in order for him to rediscover who he is.
episodes.title: Threshold (3)

episodes.plot: An alien being is smitten with Carter and follows her back to Earth. It assumes a human form and pursues a relationship with her.
episodes.title: Ascension

episodes.plot: O'Neill and Lieutenant Tyler are ambushed by Goa'uld forces and trapped behind enemy lines -- while the rest of their team discover they don't know who Tyler is.
episodes.title: The Fifth Man

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers that their recent trip through the Stargate may have inadvertently doomed an entire civilization.
episodes.title: Red Sky

episodes.plot: Cassandra mysteriously falls ill, sending SG-1 back to her home planet -- where they uncover a dark Goa'uld secret.
episodes.title: Rite of Passage

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers a civilization that uses Unas as slave labor, and attempt to liberate Daniel's friend, Chaka.
episodes.title: Beast of Burden

episodes.plot: SG-1 teams with a Russian unit when one of their Stargate teams goes missing in a mysterious alien ziggurat.
episodes.title: The Tomb

episodes.plot: The Tollan offer Earth advanced weapons technology, prompting a secret investigation on Tollana -- one that leads to a startling discovery.
episodes.title: Between Two Fires

episodes.plot: SG-1 encounters a potential new, technologically advanced ally in the war against the Goa'uld -- though they do not know the Aschen's dark secret.
When Carter goes missing, O'Neill teams up with Col. Maybourne again to free her.
episodes.title: Desperate Measures

episodes.plot: An alien ship approaches Earth, sending SG-1 to an old friend for some answers -- where they discover that Martin Lloyd has created a TV show about the Stargate program.
episodes.title: Wormhole X-Treme!

episodes.plot: SG-1 trains a team of raw cadets, and Colonel O'Neill is forced to take them into a real-life battle situation when he learns of a possible alien incursion at the SGC.
episodes.title: Proving Ground

episodes.plot: Disaster strikes the Stargate, trapping Teal'c in transit. SG-1 must turn to Russia -- and to their enemies -- for help.
episodes.title: 48 Hours

episodes.plot: The Tok'ra war with the Goa'uld escalates, and the rebel faction sends Daniel Jackson to a secret meeting between the System Lords.
episodes.title: Summit (1)

episodes.plot: Dr. Jackson's undercover mission to a Goa'uld summit is complicated by the arrival of a surprise guest. The rest of the team face a full-scale invasion of the Tok'ra homeworld.
episodes.title: Last Stand (2)

episodes.plot: Earth finds itself threatened by something even larger than the Goa'uld when the team learns that an asteroid is on a collision course with the planet.
episodes.title: Fail Safe

episodes.plot: A charismatic Jaffa leader seeks to forge an alliance between Earth and his rebel followers, winning the allegiance of Teal'c and Bra'tac.
episodes.title: The Warrior

episodes.plot: SG-1 encounters a young woman with the ability to control Replicators, and who may hold the key to the salvation of the Asgard.
episodes.title: Menace

episodes.plot: SG-1 must turn to a pair of convicted criminals to save a world from annihilation by the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: The Sentinel

episodes.plot: Daniel Jackson is exposed to a lethal dose of radiation while visiting an alien civilization that is building a weapon of mass destruction.
episodes.title: Meridian

episodes.plot: SG-1 must come to the rescue of their once-powerful allies when the Goa'uld attack a secret Asgard laboratory.
episodes.title: Revelations

episodes.plot: Tragedy reunites Teal'c with his son, who blames him for the death of his mother. O'Neill and Carter launch a risky plan with untested technology when Earth comes under attack by the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Redemption (1)

episodes.plot: Carter must find a way to save Earth from total destruction at the hands of the Goa'uld, who have turned the Stargate into a doomsday bomb. Rya'c joins his father on a mission to destroy the Goa'uld weapon.
episodes.title: Redemption (2)

episodes.plot: SG-1 boards an abandoned Goa'uld mothership that has mysteriously arrived in Earth's orbit, and must escape the doomed vessel when it crashes into the ocean.
episodes.title: Descent

episodes.plot: SG-1 investigates the discovery of a woman frozen in the ice in Antarctica, who may be a link to the gate builders. A mysterious disease threatens to kill everyone at the research base.
episodes.title: Frozen

episodes.plot: Carter, Teal'c and Jonas investigate the death of a scientist with connections to the Goa'uld, and find a small town whose citizens harbor a dark secret.
episodes.title: Nightwalkers

episodes.plot: O'Neill is captured and tortured by the Goa'uld, and must rely on an old friend to survive.
episodes.title: Abyss

episodes.plot: Jonas' people ask Earth for military aide in an impending war with their rival nations, but his former mentor offers another solution: a resistance movement ready for a coup.
episodes.title: Shadow Play

episodes.plot: When SG-1 is captured by the Goa'uld, a pair of scientists mount a rescue operation ... whether they're wanted or not.
episodes.title: The Other Guys

episodes.plot: Tensions rise between the Tok'ra and rebel Jaffa at the S.G.C.'s offworld base when they are attacked by an invisible enemy.
episodes.title: Allegiance

episodes.plot: An alien world offers Earth a medicine with the power to cure any illness -- but the hidden price may be too high to pay.
episodes.title: Cure

episodes.plot: A news reporter threatens to expose a top-secret military project, but when Carter and Jonas give her a tour of the X-303, they discover that she is a pawn in a much larger plot.
episodes.title: Prometheus (1)

episodes.plot: The team is called into battle unexpectedly when the Asgard homeworld is overrun by Replicators -- which have evolved into a startling new form.
episodes.title: Unnatural Selection (2)

episodes.plot: The team returns to Earth with a piece of technology that allows them to see alien creatures everywhere, and must attempt to contain the problem when it spreads beyond the base.
episodes.title: Sight Unseen

episodes.plot: Colonel O'Neill is charged with the murder of Senator Kinsey, and the rest of the team must uncover a conspiracy in order to clear his name.
episodes.title: Smoke & Mirrors

episodes.plot: Colonel O'Neill is trapped on an alien planet with Maybourne, and must fight to stay alive as his companion becomes increasingly paranoid.
episodes.title: Paradise Lost

episodes.plot: SG-1 attempts to save a planet's inhabitants from Nirrti's genetic experimentation, but find themselves to be her next victims.
episodes.title: Metamorphosis

episodes.plot: General Hammond and the Pentagon reveal the existence of the Stargate to other world governments, and must defend the fact that the program is operated by the United States military.
episodes.title: Disclosure

episodes.plot: When the team finds a crashed ship on another planet, their efforts to help the crew effect repairs are hindered by a group of aliens.
episodes.title: Forsaken

episodes.plot: A near-death trial causes Teal'c to imagine his life as very different from the one he knows, where he is a normal person living on Earth -- until he can no longer distinguish reality.
episodes.title: The Changeling

episodes.plot: Prometheus is forced to land on an alien world, where the local Stargate is the team's only chance of returning home -- though the local population believe the gate to be a myth.
episodes.title: Memento

episodes.plot: The team finds an impoverished world enslaved by a Goa'uld underlord, but their plans to free it may be compromised when Jonas experiences unexplained visions of the future.
episodes.title: Prophecy

episodes.plot: SG-1 is called to defend the people of Abydos from the Goa'uld once again when they learn that Anubis, in search of a powerful device, is about to attack.
episodes.title: Full Circle

episodes.plot: While searching for the Lost City of the Ancients on a distant planet, SG-1 is stunned to find Daniel Jackson alive and in human form but stripped of his memory.  O'Neill convinces Daniel to return with them to the SGC, where he is reinstated for a daring mission to destroy Anubis' powerful new super-weapon!
episodes.title: Fallen (1)

episodes.plot: The team returns to Jonas' homeworld when they learn that the Goa'uld are after its naquadria. When Jonas is captured by Anubis, Daniel is his only hope.
episodes.title: Homecoming (2)

episodes.plot: A teenage boy shows up at the S.G.C. claiming to be Jack O'Neill, sending the team on a mission to uncover his true identity.
episodes.title: Fragile Balance

episodes.plot: After an injury, Teal'c must put aside his self-doubt when SG-1 launches a mission to rescue his son and his mentor from a Jaffa death camp.
episodes.title: Orpheus

episodes.plot: The team gates to a climate-controlled environment amidst a toxic wasteland, whose people are all linked to a central computer.
episodes.title: Revisions

episodes.plot: When SG-1 finds a crashed alien space ship, Daniel's mind is taken over by its disembodied passengers.
episodes.title: Lifeboat

episodes.plot: When Earth's attempts to exploit a newly-discovered naquadah mine are thwarted by a tribe of indigenous Unas, SG-1 must turn to an old friend for help.
episodes.title: Enemy Mine

episodes.plot: Major Carter joins an alien pilot for a space race, where the winner is awarded a lucrative contract with the planet's most powerful corporation. But the rest of the team discovers that there is more at stake than the finish line.
episodes.title: Space Race

episodes.plot: An S.G.C. scientist creates a computer virus to be used to disable enemy Stargates -- but succeeds in shutting down the entire gate network.
episodes.title: Avenger 2.0

episodes.plot: The team finds a fugitive colony of Jaffa women, who must prey on other Jaffa to acquire symbiotes.
episodes.title: Birthright

episodes.plot: The team investigates an unstoppable new enemy soldier engineered by Anubis. Dr. Jackson leads a team in search of an alien device in Central America, but gets more than he bargained for.
episodes.title: Evolution (1)

episodes.plot: O'Neill seeks help from a former comrade to rescue Daniel and Dr. Lee, who have been kidnapped in Central America. Carter, Teal'c and Jacob infiltrate Anubis' super-soldier facility.
episodes.title: Evolution (2)

episodes.plot: Carter is injured when the Prometheus is attacked by an unknown ship, and awakens to find herself stranded alone in deep space.
episodes.title: Grace

episodes.plot: When the Kelownans discover that a massive underground vein of naquadah is being converted into naquadria, Jonas Quinn seeks help from Earth in avoiding the total destruction of his planet.
episodes.title: Fallout

episodes.plot: Daniel is plagued by dreams of his former girlfriend, who has been taken as a Goa'uld host. Samantha Carter begins a romantic relationship with a detective, from whom she must hide her life at Stargate Command.
episodes.title: Chimera

episodes.plot: Earth's secret offworld base is attacked by Anubis' forces, and Major Carter finds herself being hunted by the enemy. General Hammond and Jacob Carter make an unnerving discovery about the Earth-Tok'ra alliance.
episodes.title: Death Knell

episodes.plot: A film crew arrives to document the work of the S.G.C. for eventual disclosure to the public, but finds that the base's personnel are less than eager to participate.
episodes.title: Heroes (1)

episodes.plot: SG-1 is called into action while a film crew is documenting the Stargate program, but the S.G.C. comes under investigation after the mission goes terribly wrong.
episodes.title: Heroes (2)

episodes.plot: SG-1 investigates a secret N.I.D. laboratory, where a ruthless scientist has used cloning technology to create a Goa'uld-human hybrid.
episodes.title: Resurrection

episodes.plot: The newly-elected president is debriefed about the Stargate program, and Vice President Kinsey makes a new play for control of the program.
episodes.title: Inauguration

episodes.plot: O'Neill goes to great lengths to keep the Ancients' knowledge from falling into Goa'uld hands when the team discovers a second repository. The President replaces General Hammond with a civilian diplomat.
episodes.title: Lost City (1)

episodes.plot: Anubis begins a systematic assault on Earth, and the planet's only hope of salvation depends on whether SG-1 can find the Ancients' mythical Lost City.
episodes.title: Lost City (2)

episodes.plot: Carter and Teal'c go in search of the Asgard to try and save Colonel O'Neill, but discover that the Asgard's enemy has returned with a vengeance. The System Lords seek an alliance with Earth against a common enemy.
episodes.title: New Order (1)

episodes.plot: While the Goa'uld threaten to attack Earth, SG-1 and the Asgard make a last, desperate stand against the Replicators, which have captured Major Carter and invaded the last outpost of the Asgard civilization.
episodes.title: New Order (2)

episodes.plot: The S.G.C. is put under quarantine after a mysterious infection leaves a Russian officer in the infirmary -- but the disease may not be a disease at all.
episodes.title: Lockdown

episodes.plot: General O'Neill tries to settle into his new job, but faces never-ending crises - including the capture of SG-1 by the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Zero Hour

episodes.plot: Daniel is stranded on another planet after the team's arrival on an alien world sparks a violent civil war.
episodes.title: Icon

episodes.plot: Teal'c is trapped in a virtual reality simulation, in which he must defend the base from a Goa'uld super-soldier incursion.
episodes.title: Avatar

episodes.plot: Teal'c becomes the chief suspect in a murder investigation after he moves into an apartment off-base. Carter considers her future with Pete.
episodes.title: Affinity

episodes.plot: A businessman threatens to expose the secrets of alien life to the world, forcing Stargate Command to bring him into the loop.
episodes.title: Covenant

episodes.plot: The impending wedding of his son is the least of Teal'c's worries when the Hak'tyl plan an uprising against the Goa'uld Moloc, driving a wedge between Teal'c and Ishta.
episodes.title: Sacrifices

episodes.plot: The Stargate is stolen, leading SG-1 to discover that the Trust has taken control of an advanced ship in orbit. Teal'c investigates a series of wide-spread Jaffa deaths.
episodes.title: Endgame

episodes.plot: A duplicate of Colonel Carter seeks help from Stargate Command in defeating the Replicator Fifth, who she claims has found a way to counter the Asgard's new weapon.
episodes.title: Gemini

episodes.plot: After the Prometheus responds to a distress call from a Goa'uld ship, Daniel Jackson finds himself a captive when Earth's ship is stolen.
episodes.title: Prometheus Unbound

episodes.plot: SG-1 comes to the aid of a world about to be invaded by the Goa'uld, only to discover that the local king is Earth's Harry Maybourne.
episodes.title: It's Good to Be King

episodes.plot: Relations between the U.S. and Russia are strained when Russian military leaders claim that the U.S. government has been compromised by the Goa'uld.
episodes.title: Full Alert

episodes.plot: Jack is confronted in his home by an irate barber...who claims to know everything about the Stargate project and SG-1.
episodes.title: Citizen Joe

episodes.plot: The Replicators begin a systematic attack of the Goa'uld, forcing Baal to come to Earth for help. The Jaffa Resistance risk their entire movement in an attempt to retake a holy city in Baal's domain.
episodes.title: Reckoning (1)

episodes.plot: The fate of the galaxy hangs in the balance as Sam and Jacob search for the only weapon capable of stopping the Replicator onslaught. O'Neill leads a defense of the S.G.C., while Daniel squares off against Replicator Carter.
episodes.title: Reckoning (2)

episodes.plot: While Daniel finds himself in a mysterious diner suspended between death and ascension, Jacob's fate takes an unexpected turn, Jack and Sam consider their romantic lives, and Anubis unleashes his plan for galactic destruction.
episodes.title: Threads

episodes.plot: SG-1 travels back in time in a daring plan to steal a piece of Ancient technology from Ra, the powerful Goa'uld who ruled in ancient Egypt.
episodes.title: Moebius (1)

episodes.plot: With the timeline changed by SG-1's actions in the distant past, an alternate version of SG-1 must use the newly-discovered time ship to set things right.
episodes.title: Moebius (2)

episodes.plot: An Air Force pilot attempts to reassemble SG-1 after they have gone their separate ways. An old "friend" arrives on Earth asking for Daniel's help in finding an ancient treasure -- and she won't take no for an answer.
episodes.title: Avalon (1)

episodes.plot: An Ancient communications device renders Daniel and Vala unconscious, sending their minds to another galaxy -- where they inhabit the bodies of two people persecuted by the followers of an evil religion.
episodes.title: Avalon (2)

episodes.plot: Daniel comes face to face with the Ori, a fiery race of beings who demand the worship of mortals. Elsewhere, Stargate Command encounters the first Ori missionary in our galaxy.
episodes.title: Origin (3)

episodes.plot: Jackson and Mitchell must join Vala on an interplanetary scavenger hunt when they learn that they are still bound together by an alien energy field.
episodes.title: The Ties That Bind

episodes.plot: SG-1 visits a world whose people once worshipped Vala as a god -- and demand that she stand trial when she confesses to manipulating them.
episodes.title: The Powers That Be

episodes.plot: Samantha Carter returns to Stargate Command when the Ori seize control of a planet, using an expanding force field to gain a foothold in our galaxy.
episodes.title: Beachhead

episodes.plot: SG-1 investigates when evidence suggests that there are still Goa'uld hiding on Earth -- including a former System Lord. Tensions between Earth and the Free Jaffa continue to mount.
episodes.title: Ex Deus Machina

episodes.plot: Colonel Mitchell is injured in a skirmish with a warrior from a mythic tribe of rebel Jaffa, and is trained in their fighting techniques only so that he may engage in a ritual battle to the death.
episodes.title: Babylon

episodes.plot: SG-1 finds a genetically advanced Goa'uld-human hybrid created by Anubis, and returns him to Earth for study. But even keeping him alive may not be worth the risk.
episodes.title: Prototype

episodes.plot: Earth is infected with a deadly Ori plague, prompting an ally from SG-1's past to come to their aide. Gerak proposes that the Free Jaffa follow the Ori religion.
episodes.title: The Fourth Horseman (1)

episodes.plot: As the Ori plague spreads rapidly, SG-1 hopes that the Prior who caused the disease may hold the key to its cure. Gerak tries to rally the Jaffa to the Ori's cause, prompting Teal'c and Bra'tac to initiate a resistance.
episodes.title: The Fourth Horseman (2)

episodes.plot: When SG-1 travels to an Asgard Protected Planet, Colonel Mitchell is accused of a murder he did not commit.
episodes.title: Collateral Damage

episodes.plot: Multiple SG-1s show up at Stargate Command, leading the "real" team to conclude that they have each been inadvertantly displaced from different parallel realities.
episodes.title: Ripple Effect

episodes.plot: Baal kidnaps Teal'c as part of a plot to brainwash those Jaffa advocating a move toward democracy. Cameron Mitchell learns that an old friend is about to die.
episodes.title: Stronghold

episodes.plot: Daniel is imprisoned on a world under the influence of the Ori, and the Prometheus is caught in a firefight when SG-1 tries to rescue him.
episodes.title: Ethon

episodes.plot: SG-1 is captured after a deal with the Lucian Alliance goes bad ... and the planet's Stargate goes missing. Meanwhile, a former System Lord attempts to rebuild his empire.
episodes.title: Off the Grid

episodes.plot: A tour of an off-world research base for a group of foreign diplomats turns dangerous when an insidious insect species gets loose.
episodes.title: The Scourge

episodes.plot: Mitchell and Carter are shifted to another dimension, making them invisible to everyone at the S.G.C. Meanwhile, Teal'c and SG-9 discover that the Sodan have been brutally attacked.
episodes.title: Arthur's Mantle

episodes.plot: Vala Mal Doran makes contact with Stargate Command from the Ori home galaxy, and tells the story of her life undercover in a village of followers building the Ori's invasion fleet.
episodes.title: Crusade

episodes.plot: SG-1 discovers the village of Camelot on an alien world, and must face Merlin's security system when they go in search of an Ancient weapon. Elsewhere, Earth and its allies assemble a fleet when a working Ori Supergate is discovered.
episodes.title: Camelot

episodes.plot: As the Ori invade the Jaffa planet Chulak, Vala and Daniel must deal with their leader: Vala's young daughter, rapidly aged by the Ori to serve their purposes.
episodes.title: Flesh and Blood

episodes.plot: SG-1 investigates a problem off-world and soon finds that they have become victims themselves: they cannot stay awake. Meanwhile, Vala Mal Doran undergoes an evaluation on Earth, hoping to join SG-1.
episodes.title: Morpheus

episodes.plot: Daniel and Vala travel to Atlantis in search of Merlin's anti-Ori weapon, while Sam, and Mitchell join forces with Dr. McKay to lock out the Ori supergate.
episodes.title: The Pegasus Project

episodes.plot: When Baal comes to Earth seeking help, Stargate Command must capture his clones and determine which one is the genuine article.
episodes.title: Insiders

episodes.plot: Teal'c discovers a world where people are being savagely attacked by an elusive creature, leading SG-1 to a stunning discovery about its potential origin.
episodes.title: Uninvited

episodes.plot: Martin Lloyd seeks out SG-1 for assistance when his failed TV show based on the real Stargate program becomes a feature film.
The Jaffa take the fight to the Ori, using a genocidal weapon on their new worshipers and landing SG-1 in the middle of a war they can't control.
episodes.title: Counterstrike

episodes.plot: Striken with amnesia and on the run, Vala takes a job as a waitress as she tries to piece together who she is and what happened to her.
episodes.title: Memento Mori

episodes.plot: Cameron Mitchell must go undercover inside the deadly Lucian Alliance to prevent his teammates from becoming casualties of an Alliance civil war.
episodes.title: Company of Thieves

episodes.plot: SG-1 races against Baal in the hunt to find the Sangraal, Merlin's anti-Ori weapon, and comes up against a series of ancient trials.
episodes.title: The Quest (1)

episodes.plot: When the team finds Merlin himself, they must help him complete the Sangraal weapon before Adria and her Ori forces can track them down.
episodes.title: The Quest (2)

episodes.plot: SG-1 tries to defend a planet from the Ori by hiding its people in another dimension. Vala attempts to convince her husband Tomin of the Ori's true motives.
episodes.title: Line in the Sand

episodes.plot: An experiment gone wrong pulls Samantha Carter into a parallel reality, where she must save Earth from an Ori assault before she will be allowed to return home.
episodes.title: The Road Not Taken

episodes.plot: When SG-1 discovers that Daniel Jackson has been turned into a Prior of the Ori, they must determine whether or not his plan to destroy the Ori is genuine.
episodes.title: The Shroud

episodes.plot: When the Lucian Alliance puts a bounty on SG-1's heads, Cameron Mitchell finds himself a target while attending his high school reunion.
episodes.title: Bounty

episodes.plot: SG-1 realizes they have stepped through the gate into another planet's museum -- but are mistaken for a band of zealous rebels who have taken hostages.
episodes.title: Bad Guys

episodes.plot: When a terrorist attack decimates a Jaffa summit Teal'c strikes out on a quest for revenge, believing that the perpetrator is one of his own pupils.
episodes.title: Talion

episodes.plot: Earth provides sanctuary for Vala's estranged, con artist father after he provides intel about a Jaffa plot to attack the planet.
episodes.title: Family Ties

episodes.plot: SG-1 hatches an elaborate plan to try and capture Adria, using Vala as bait.
episodes.title: Dominion

episodes.plot: Trapped on board the Odyssey, the members of SG-1 must live out the rest of their lives together when Carter activates a time dilation field to save the ship from destruction.
episodes.title: Unending
